author: Cherokee's Grip
title: One Kick at a Time
text:
One Kick at a Time 
When we played Missouri in game se'n of twelve,we for some reasons into which I'll deeply delvedevised a plan to deal with losin' our runnin' back. 
Our playbook had had some pages ripped out,and our O'd been filled with fear and doubtas our Knoxville losses spelled doom for the red and black. 
That week, we devised ourselves a schemethat should be envy of most any team:We'd get ourselves a win with no touchdowns on the board.Now kickin' scores meant scorin' littleand I figured I'd have to work for the fans' acquittal,and Tigers'd have to join us in one accord. 
We'd win it one kick at a time;it'd make our gameday sublime.We'd thrill the fans in stands round Athenstown.We're gonna stall our drives in style;we're gonna drive all the Dawg fans wild‘cause we'll have the best gameplan there is around. 
But the very first play when Lambert threwa real bad first pass just like I told him to,the Tigers' D tried to break our little deal.They picked off ol' Lambert even though they sworethat they wouldn't touchdowns attempt to score.Our victory from our genius plot they did try to steal. 
Our walk-on receiver that Tiger whopped,and the defense, they got them an awesome goal-line stop.Then the offense their grand mission began to start.We ran some plays that could get our team downfieldto keep our plans from fans concealedand to get us close enough so our kicker'd do his part. 
Throughout the game, our plan went all rightas we tried to play bad ball to keep the game tight.Fourth quarter, we noticed that something was definitely wrong.Ol' Missouri had scored field goals two,and the Bulldogs had only scored two field goals, too.So we knew that we had to score before fourth quarter'd gone. 
So we ran our backs up the middle someand Grayson Lambert hit some throws to establish rhythm.We had that offense runnin' just like a song.Now the kicker had uprights in sight,but he pushed it just left of almost just right.So we were still tied at six with six minutes withdrawn. 
The defense did what it had to doas they broke up the Tigers on a pass or twoand then it was time for our O to begin again.The fans, they loved that 3-and-out,and I could hear in their cheers that they had no doubtas they said with a shout loudly, "Bulldogs, let's go for the win." 
So we drove up field just to get in range;we did it all in two minutes and changeas our warming-up kicker practiced his field goal kicks.Then out there from the sidelines, our kicker approachedafter an "I love you" from the head coachand when he got through, the Dawgs led 9 to 6. 
We won it one kick at a timeand it made our gameday sublime.We thrilled the fans in stands ‘round Athenstown.Oh, yeah, we stalled our drives in style,oh, and we drove all the Dawg fans wild.‘Cause we had the best gameplan there was around. 
Woof! Yeah, High Lighter,this is the Schotty Fence,with the Psycho-QB No-Schott-Fence, come on!And negatory on the tally of touchdowns there, High Lighter.You might just say I took over our playbook and kicked it up;it's better that way.Uh! How'd we do it?Oh, well, we kicked it once, kicked it twice, missed it once, kicked it thrice, and ran it up the middle a really great deal.Oh, and they kicked it once, missed it once, kicked it twice, and did some stuff and got stuffed by our defense a really great deal. 
On a side note, for Hate Week, I'm planning on doing a series of 5 Disney songs that I'll label--of course--"Disney Dawgs." Someone requested some Elton John, so I'll be doing a heart-warming parody called "Can You Feel the Hate Tonight." Please feel free to request other potential Disney songs to parody in the comments. I make no promises as requests tend to be hit or miss for me, but I'll take them under advisement. Poll Do you loathe the Florida Gators with the fire of a thousand suns being powered by another thousand suns? Yes.
